result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacquada N Pittman-Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lacquada N Pittman-Harris in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Lacquada N Pittman-Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for an entry into DPA. Defense requested an adjourned to allow additional time for defense to discuss the agreement. State did not object. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lacquada N Pittman-Harris in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Lacquada N Pittman-Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Defense informs the Court this case is in a DPA resolution posture and requests a DPA hearing. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lacquada N Pittman-Harris in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lacquada N Pittman-Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY. 
Victims AJB and RAH appeared via Zoom.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lacquada N Pittman-Harris in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and potential offer. State confims pending tad evaluation.  
Court ordered matter adjourned. Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse. 
This hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 6/4/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lacquada N Pittman-Harris in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AB, RF
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@130p
